title: Report format for GitLab SAST
description: This schema provides the report format for Static Application Security Testing analyzers (https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/application_security/sast).

end_time.description: ISO8601 UTC value with format yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss, representing when the scan finished.

items.description: Communication intended for the initiator of a scan.

level.description: Describes the severity of the communication. Use info to communicate normal scan behaviour; warn to communicate a potentially recoverable problem, or a partial error; fatal to communicate an issue that causes the scan to halt.

scanner.description: Object defining the scanner used to perform the scan.

id.description: Unique id that identifies the scanner.

name.description: A human readable value that identifies the scanner, not required to be unique.

url.description: A link to more information about the scanner.

start_time.description: ISO8601 UTC value with format yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss, representing when the scan started.

schema.description: URI pointing to the validating security report schema.

version.description: Report syntax version used to generate this JSON.

id.description: Unique identifier of the vulnerability. This is recommended to be a UUID.

category.description: Describes where this vulnerability belongs (for example, SAST, Dependency Scanning, and so on).

name.description: The name of the vulnerability. This must not include the finding's specific information.

message.description: A short text section that describes the vulnerability. This may include the finding's specific information.

description.description: A long text section describing the vulnerability more fully.

cve.description: (Deprecated - use vulnerabilities[].id instead) A fingerprint string value that represents a concrete finding. This is used to determine whether two findings are same, which may not be 100% accurate. Note that this is NOT a CVE as described by https://cve.mitre.org/.

severity.description: How much the vulnerability impacts the software. Possible values are Info, Unknown, Low, Medium, High, or Critical. Note that some analyzers may not report all these possible values.

confidence.description: How reliable the vulnerability's assessment is. Possible values are Ignore, Unknown, Experimental, Low, Medium, High, and Confirmed. Note that some analyzers may not report all these possible values.

solution.description: Explanation of how to fix the vulnerability.

scanner.description: Describes the scanner used to find this vulnerability.

id.description: The scanner's ID, as a snake_case string.

name.description: Name of the scanner, for display purposes.

identifiers.description: An ordered array of references that identify a vulnerability on internal or external databases. The first identifier is the Primary Identifier, which has special meaning.

type.description: for example, cve, cwe, osvdb, usn, or an analyzer-dependent type such as gemnasium).

name.description: Name of the identifier, for display purposes.

value.description: Value of the identifier, for matching purpose.

links.description: An array of references to external documentation or articles that describe the vulnerability.

name.description: Name of the vulnerability details link.

url.description: URL of the vulnerability details document.

file.description: Path to the file where the vulnerability is located.

start_line.description: The first line of the code affected by the vulnerability.

end_line.description: The last line of the code affected by the vulnerability.

class.description: Provides the name of the class where the vulnerability is located.

method.description: Provides the name of the method where the vulnerability is located.

remediations.description: An array of objects containing information on available remediations, along with patch diffs to apply.

fixes.description: An array of strings that represent references to vulnerabilities fixed by this remediation.

cve.description: (Deprecated - use vulnerabilities[].id instead) A fingerprint string value that represents a concrete finding. This is used to determine whether two findings are same, which may not be 100% accurate. Note that this is NOT a CVE as described by https://cve.mitre.org/.

summary.description: An overview of how the vulnerabilities were fixed.

diff.description: A base64-encoded remediation code diff, compatible with git apply.
